intro: Pavonia mattogrossensis, commonly known as the Brazilian flame flower, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, vibrant red to orange flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are ovate to elliptic, with a rough texture and a slightly hairy surface. Pavonia mattogrossensis is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun.
